description: Single and two storey side extensions; single and two storey rear extension; rear dormer; external alterations; detached garage; remove and relocate existing vehicle access; landscaping including increased hardstanding for driveway and parking
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development, fails to provide current and up to date ecology and biodiversity assessments to establish whether protected species are present on site. As such, the&nbsp; development is contrary to Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021), policy DM20 of the Harrow Development Management policies (2013) and P<span style="font-family: Candara, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">aragraph 99 of the Circular 06/05</span></p>

<p>The&nbsp;<span style="line-height: 107%;">proposed
rear dormer extension by reason of its excessive combined size, scale and bulk,
would appear incongruous on the rear elevation and</span><span style="line-height: 107%; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;"> would </span><span style="line-height: 107%;">give
rise to a disproportionate addition which would fail to respect the proportions
and character of the original building. The proposed development would
therefore be contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National
Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policies D3 of The London
Plan (2021), Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Development Management Plan Local Policies (2013) and
the Adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></p>

<p>The&nbsp;proposed extensions would be materially larger
than the existing dwellinghouse on site and would cause harm to the purposes of
including land in the Green Belt and the openness and visual amenity of the
Green Belt. It would therefore constitute inappropriate development in the
Green Belt, for which no very special circumstances have been demonstrated by
the applicant, as the harm identified is outweighed by other considerations.
contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy G2 of The
London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.F of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012),
Policy DM16 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan
(2013).&nbsp;</p>
